intro: Pecteilis dianthoides, commonly known as the Texas starburst, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow, star-shaped flowers that appear in early spring. It has hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Pecteilis dianthoides is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
